acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour EC50=0.077mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1998).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Data is only rat LD50 >2000mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)). Since data is insufficient, it cannot be classified.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: It was classified as Category 4 based on rat LC50 (4h) = 4420ppm (PATTY (5th, 2001)). Since LC50 value was lower than 90% of saturated vapor pressure concentration, the gaseous classification Category was applied for the classification.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 682 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: PATTY (5th, 2001)

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on an animal experimentation (chemical pneumonia, etc.), though Dynamic viscosity: <=14 mm2/s.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF=70 of diethyl disulfide as degradation product (existing chemical safety inspections data)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gas substances are not available. Boiling point: 35degC (ICSC, 2004)

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 1 because of its flash point: -48.3degC and boiling point: 35degC (ICSC, 2004). UNRTDG No. 2363, Class: 3, PG

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on evaluation of "slight irritant" (PATTY (5th, 2001)) and "moderate" (RTECS (2004)) as a result of the eye stimulativeness examination of a rabbit, it was set as Category 2A-2B .

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: As results of animal examinations,  "Moderate erythema (redness/inflammation)" on rabbits, "pain and skin discoloration" on rats are reported (PATTY (5th, 2001)), however, there are also descriptions that respective irritation disappeared in less than 24 hours or not sustained. Therefore, it was judged to be mild and was classified as Category 3.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Although the examination of inhalation exposure in humans and an animal is carried out, all of a toxic phenomena are mild because of low concentrations. Therefore, since data is insufficient, it cannot be classified.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (central nervous system),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is the effect to central nervous system (disappearance of righting reflex, incoordination, the abnormalities in a walk, weakness, headache, vomiting) in animal test (PATTY (5th, 2001), IUCLID (2000)), and there is the report that the symptoms such as headache, vomitting, incoordination, weakness even in human (IUCLID (2000), HSDB (2002)). So it is classified into Category 1 (central nervous). Moreover, there is the mild irritation to respiratory mucous membrane in both of human and animal (IUCLID (2000)). So it is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation).
